subject: Real Estate
title: When Speculation Replaces Habitation
description: Learn When Speculation Replaces Habitation in one minute.

hook.text: In Miami in 2005, 70% of condo sales were to investors who never intended to live in the units.

buildup.text: Speculators buy pre-construction, flip at closing, and never touch a doorknob.

discovery.text: When most buyers are investors, prices reflect expected resale value, not living utility.

twist.text: Speculative demand vanishes overnight. A neighborhood of investors has no residents to anchor prices.

climax.text: Miami condo prices fell 50% by 2009. Entire towers sat empty because nobody wanted to actually live there.

punchline.text: A city built for flippers has no one to flip to.

quiz.question: What percentage of 2005 Miami condo sales were to investors?
